page.title: 14BREAGE
page.content: This village is situated about three miles west of Helston. It was originally a mining village. The name Breage originates from an Irish Saint called{Breaca}who established a church in the village. When mining was an important industry in the area the village had three Wesleyan chapels, one church, two public houses and a bakery. It has an annual fair held in June which survives from the mining period. The public well and water pump also survive which at one time served the village and outlying district. The village was also the home of the Godolphin family who owned the local mine and represented Helston in parliament.
